lines.text: Last trebuchet village arc was Tales from the Seabomb, End of the World, Sin Bad, Virtue Good, Lady Better.
Which was supposed to be an adventure to realms deep, the supposed end of the world, in order to rescue Solvin the Frog from his death in the terrifying realm, the one you caused.
You'd explore the islands of the virtue good archipelago, Archipelago? Archipelago? Archipelago.
Learn more about the creatures that live there, both native and colonized by the Terrafire Kingdom,
visiting port towns that hinted at incredible strange lands and adventures unknown to you or
anyone within the kingdom. Instead, you hate Sullivan and decided to try to sail as far
away from him as possible.
The epic joke would have been that because the world is round, and nobody knows that,
you would have found your way to the end of the world either way, and therefore to Sullivan.
However, instead, Patrick Yodar, Evil Stievel, and Rod Doge and you the Dirt Goblin, the
original crew, encountered world pools, hot babes, strange runes and witches, beasts and
Spongebob Islands, fleshy submarines, death, and vanishing acts.
Patrick learned of his uncle/father, Trunchbull's, past as a member of a pirate crew,
60 tricksters eating chicky tinders and their mixing genders with their 120 fingers,
and a maroon placed on his mother who lived on Hot Babe Island.
That killed her when Patrick tried to speak with her about some sort of truth,
a truth she kept long buried, that likely will die with her.
And then Patrick died soon after that.
But not before he helped to create mud marks from the corpse of his mother, himself, and a couple of ugly women.
The goal became to vibe mud marks, and the only place to do that would be the Berry Berry Academy.
In honor of Patrick, they would do so. And also because that would be funny for you guys to do.
Once the now two heroes were set on a journey, a mysterious massive yethound chased you across the sea,
and that became easier to avoid once Evil Ndoga invited Chuggie the Singing Submarine to their party,
and sailed within him, or, they were inside of his body, and they went through the sea.
A couple other adventure-y moments happened until they reached Port Los Beriberi, a port
town where they can get entry to the academy if they knew the right people.
They stumbled on one of those people, Condoleezza Carlo, a powerful, psychopathic warlock who
lives in a lighthouse off the coast of Beriberi and tricks sailors into crashing their ships
and robbing them of their goods.
He said he'd help our heroes become academy professors so they could vive mud marks if
they investigated the Popo Tower at the southern tip of the Terrifier Kingdom, where, apparently,
Stickyfingers was headed.
Stickyfingers at this point was the leader of the Thieves' Guild, or originally was the
leader of the Thieves' Guild in the Terrifier Kingdom, but after King Nardwuar's madness
subsided and people started to doubt his ability to rule, he rose in rank, filled in some sort
of void there, became a more... part of the kingdom in a more official capacity as a
powerful intelligence organization, leader of a powerful intelligence
organization. Sticky Fingers was also a part of Trunchbull's crew, the 60
tricksters eating Chicky Tinders crew, and may have had answers about
Patrick's origin and why his mother died, and may have even caused it, it's unclear.
However, to get any of these questions answered, they'd have to meet with him, but once they
reached the Popo Tower and scaled it, our heroes came face to face with a dead Sticky Fingers,
who died in a fray because of an incredible battle between a massive, harpy, bird-like
woman and a ghost or spirit of some kind that resembled the police, the virtuous god of

likely in another one.

to build that into the story here.

Marlon Rees is a hardy tiefling who works in the town of Wayneswood just outside of the
academy, the Berryberry Academy.
His daughter, Regatta Rees, is a 12th year student there, set to graduate and join an
advisory council to a lord in the dirtlands just up north.
Regatta's magical prowess meant she could get a near full ride to the academy, provided
Marlon worked at the crystal mines every day for 12 hours with no breaks.
So Marlin did just that.
Marlin didn't have a knack for magic, he could barely cast an alert spell, crucial to his
mining work.
But he was strong, spending over a decade in the Klutzes, a now dwindling monster hunter
guild.
And he was crafty, fashioning his leather belt with a sigil his daughter enchanted to rattle
in the instance of a cave-in.
He was lucky he could count on her, and when she finally leaves the academy, the money she'll
send back from the dirtlands should provide him something resembling retirement.
Marlon Rees has worked Mine 24A for over 30 years, and he has never been deeper in the
mine than he is now.
His headlamp, powered by one of the many crystals mined by the workers like him, is augmented
with a brighter light that can also sense hostility or precariousness as the cone of
light moves across the surface, creating a faint outline of alternating colors around
lit objects that indicate levels of danger.
It assesses the familiarity with a territory or object, it contains an index for extreme
motion and temperature, as well as the will of anything that is lit, an estimation of
it.
It's an incredibly complex sigil, another of Rigatta's inventions, one that got her
into the academy in the first place at the age of ten.
Despite Beriberi Academy's distaste for her family's ability to pay admission, or inability,
Rigatta's aptitude simply could not be denied.
This far down the mine, Marlin has seen an outline of light orange around most of the
cliffs and jagged rock scattered, jutting about, no longer contained by a proper mining tunnel.
The color likely relates to a combination of unfamiliarity of the territory and the
sharp decline as Marlin continues his descent.
He uses his long, strong tiefling tail to help stabilize his climb, using his claws to grip
the sides of the rock face.
Meanwhile, a container, given to him by the Pleasureman Lord, clanked against his belt.
occasionally interrupting his footing, but he made do, shifting his body and readjusting
his weight, looking for the occasional surface that could almost pass as a platform where
there's not such a risk of each one crumbling beneath his heavy boots.
His years fighting monsters and mining, along with his being a tiefling, made his hands
rough, his body strong, but also his bones beaten and himself fatigued.
Still he made his way down, further and further.
This was his way out, after all.
You'd never have to work a day in these damned mines again.
He just needs to find a soft crystal.

And we look now above at the Beriberi Academy.
From the sky above the Terrafire Kingdom, were you to look down on E-Bomb, you'd see
a landmass of browns, whites, grays, and tans, the static blues of the sea, all of it cut
off by a vast, churning, otherworldly white fog. And then, on the southernmost part of
the landmass, a sharp, bright, glittering gleam of azure, twinkling pockmarks upon the earth.
Diving through the clouds, these reveal themselves to be the famous beriberi crystals, massive
deposits that hover just above the green sloping spires that make up the academy, lighting the
manicured garden below. The Academy itself sits atop a pond, seemingly hovering above
nothing. Any member of the Academy must pass an initial test of identifying the interplanar
floor that rests above the water. Once they do, they are able to walk atop of it, between
the buildings. Everyone else can take the magically powered skiffs that litter the pond
and help the non-magical staff and visitors navigate the Academy.
The Beriberi Academy's De Minestrone, the main building at the center of the Minestrone
Pond has a large atrium and auditorium that links to the four massive spires that connect
via alabaster bridges.
Each of the four spires that make up the castle, the minestrone, represents one of the four
houses.
House Birdo, House Megabat, House Giant, and House Kaiju Manji.
They house the students and faculty and have classes that specialize in magics often associated
with each house.
The four spires that make up the Dei Minestrone contain elevators for non-magic users, but
but is otherwise largely composed of rapidly changing chutes and ladders that magical students
and faculty alike must anticipate and navigate to get from one location to the next.
The other buildings surrounding the academy include a center of combat, athletics, and
dangerous magics, a greenhouse, alchemical lab, and runic experimentation facility, artificer
workshop, a creature sanctuary, and a rotating crop farm, grain storage, and warehouse for
non-magical creatures.
There are varying observatories and chambers that exist amongst and atop the spires, all
outfitted to equip any aspiring witches, wizards, warlocks, and the like with whatever they need
to excel.
We return to the Dei Minestrone, that main building, and climb the Kaiju Manji spire.
